comments: The compositions of n in which each natural number is colored by one of p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n. For n>=1, a(n) equals the number of 31-colored compositions of n such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - _Milan Janjic_, Nov 17 2011Numbers n such that sigma(31*n) = 31*n + sigma(n). - _Jahangeer Kholdi_, Nov 23 2013
